title: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari's party says ready to talk with Imran Khan
US elections: Kamala Harris' campaign raises record $200 million in first week, signs up 170,000 volunteers
content: Kamala Harris' campaign raised $200 million in the first week after she became the Democratic presidential nominee following Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. She gained the support of over 170,000 volunteers and several prominent Democrats, including the Obamas. Despite her growing support, Harris continues to consider herself an underdog in the race.
summary: Kamala Harris' campaign raised $200 million in the first week after she became the Democratic presidential nominee following Biden's withdrawal and endorsement. She gained the support of over 170,000 volunteers and several prominent Democrats, including the Obamas. Despite her growing support, Harris continues to consider herself an underdog in the race.

title: US's Blinken calls on Venezuela parties to 'respect democratic process' in vote
content: Ahead of the Venezuelan election, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged all parties to respect the democratic process. Incumbent President Nicolas Maduro faces strong opposition from Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia. Tensions are high, as Maduro threatened violence if he loses. The US stressed that any lifting of sanctions depends on the fairness of the vote.
summary: Ahead of the Venezuelan election, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged all parties to respect the democratic process. Incumbent President Nicolas Maduro faces strong opposition from Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia. Tensions are high, as Maduro threatened violence if he loses. The US stressed that any lifting of sanctions depends on the fairness of the vote.

title: Putin threatens to restart production of intermediate-range nuclear weapons if US ...
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin threatened on Sunday that Russia could resume the production of intermediate-range nuclear missiles if the US deployed long-range missiles in Germany. He warned that such actions from the US might trigger a Cold War-style missile crisis. This statement followed the US announcement to deploy long-range fire capabilities in Germany by 2026, aiming to reinforce NATO and European defense.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin threatened on Sunday that Russia could resume the production of intermediate-range nuclear missiles if the US deployed long-range missiles in Germany. He warned that such actions from the US might trigger a Cold War-style missile crisis. This statement followed the US announcement to deploy long-range fire capabilities in Germany by 2026, aiming to reinforce NATO and European defense.

title: Lithium battery fire traps drivers for hours on California highway
'Unforeseen consequences': Iran warns Israel over attacks on Lebanon after Golan strike
content: Iran warned Israel of unforeseen consequences after a deadly rocket strike in the Golan Heights linked to Hezbollah. Iran's foreign ministry spokesman stressed that Israeli actions could lead to instability and war. Tehran accused Israel of diverting attention from its actions in Gaza and insisted Israel would be held accountable for its conduct.
summary: Iran warned Israel of unforeseen consequences after a deadly rocket strike in the Golan Heights linked to Hezbollah. Iran's foreign ministry spokesman stressed that Israeli actions could lead to instability and war. Tehran accused Israel of diverting attention from its actions in Gaza and insisted Israel would be held accountable for its conduct.

Paris Olympics: Palestinian boxer wears shirt depicting bombed children in Gaza
content: ​​The embroidered images on his white shirt showed warplanes dropping missiles over children playing sports. Abu Sal explained that the shirt represents the current situation in Palestine, where children are being killed and left alone without basic necessities. "This shirt represents the current picture in Palestine," news agency AFP quoted Waseem Abu as saying.
summary: ​​The embroidered images on his white shirt showed warplanes dropping missiles over children playing sports. Abu Sal explained that the shirt represents the current situation in Palestine, where children are being killed and left alone without basic necessities. "This shirt represents the current picture in Palestine," news agency AFP quoted Waseem Abu as saying.

title: 'I looked and there was just ...': New York mom finds daughter’s Burger King meal splattered with blood
Israeli airstrikes target Hezbollah in Lebanon after deadly rocket attack
'Created by weak US President & VP': Trump blames Biden, Harris for Hezbollah attacks on Israel killing 12
content: Donald Trump attributed the recent Hezbollah rocket strike on a soccer field in northern Israel, which killed 12 children, to the perceived weakness of President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris. While Biden's team expressed support for Israel, Hezbollah denied involvement in the attack. The tragedy heightened tensions and drew sharp political criticism.
summary: Donald Trump attributed the recent Hezbollah rocket strike on a soccer field in northern Israel, which killed 12 children, to the perceived weakness of President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris. While Biden's team expressed support for Israel, Hezbollah denied involvement in the attack. The tragedy heightened tensions and drew sharp political criticism.

title: Watch: New Manchester Airport video captures moments before man 'kicked' in head by police officer
Britain is 'broke and broken', newly-elected Labour govt claims
content: The British government declared the country financially troubled, citing a £20 billion shortfall. Newly-elected Labour plans to blame the previous Conservative government for unfunded commitments. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves is set to present a fiscal review in parliament, targeting financial transparency and realistic budget plans.
summary: The British government declared the country financially troubled, citing a £20 billion shortfall. Newly-elected Labour plans to blame the previous Conservative government for unfunded commitments. Finance Minister Rachel Reeves is set to present a fiscal review in parliament, targeting financial transparency and realistic budget plans.

California Park wildfire destroys more than 3.5 lakh acres, becomes largest in US
content: The Park Fire, burning about 90 miles north of Sacramento, had destroyed 134 structures as of Saturday afternoon. Authorities arrested a man on Thursday, suspecting that he started the fire by pushing a flaming car into a gully on Wednesday afternoon.
summary: The Park Fire, burning about 90 miles north of Sacramento, had destroyed 134 structures as of Saturday afternoon. Authorities arrested a man on Thursday, suspecting that he started the fire by pushing a flaming car into a gully on Wednesday afternoon.

title: Korean War anniversary: North Korea vows 'total destruction' of enemies
content: North Korea recently threatened to 'totally destroy' the US and South Korea if war breaks out, as ordered by Kim Jong Un. This announcement came during the 71st anniversary of the Korean War armistice. Military officials accused the US and South Korea of provoking nuclear war and pledged to strengthen their defense readiness.
summary: North Korea recently threatened to 'totally destroy' the US and South Korea if war breaks out, as ordered by Kim Jong Un. This announcement came during the 71st anniversary of the Korean War armistice. Military officials accused the US and South Korea of provoking nuclear war and pledged to strengthen their defense readiness.
